definition: radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
to introduce (sb to sb)/to give a presentation/to present (sb for a job etc)/introduction
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
matchmaking/abbr. for 婚姻介紹|婚姻介绍
to care about/to take offense/to mind
to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously

sentences.english: Do you care to  give us an example?
sentences.chinese: 您介不介意给我们举个例子？

sentences.english: Halogen atoms contain seven electrons in their valence shell.
sentences.chinese: 卤原子在它们的介电子层含有七个电子。

sentences.english: This paper introduced the basic principle of dielectrophoresis.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍了介电泳的基本原理。

sentences.english: She disguised herself as a man, but she couldn't disguised her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己乔装成一个男子，介改不了自己的声音。

sentences.english: Chloroplasts of the two cases exhibit spatially different patterns of motion during dielectrophoresis.
sentences.chinese: 在实施介电泳时，两者的叶绿体呈现不同型态的运动。

sentences.english: Excuse me, sir. Would you mind moving over a little?
sentences.chinese: 先生，对不起，您介不介意移过去一点儿？

sentences.english: The Cutting Machine is used for cutting the cream-spread and laminated wafer into required size.
sentences.chinese: 介切机将涂叠压好饼片介切成合要求尺寸的小饼片。

sentences.english: In the meantime, the introduction of Chinese cultural treasures to the world, without doubts, relies on translation.
sentences.chinese: 同时，中国要向外传介文化精髓，靠的也是翻译。

sentences.english: A non-intrusive micromanipulation technique, dielectrophoresis, can be used to assist the investigation of intracellular adjustment.
sentences.chinese: 介电泳是种非侵入式的微操控术。

sentences.english: The content of PPO had some influence on the dielectric properties of the blend.
sentences.chinese: 聚苯醚的含量对共混体系的介电性能有一定的影响。

definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
plain cotton clothing/(literary) the common people
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
after all/to investigate/to study carefully/Taiwan pr. [jiu4]
